<<<<<<< HEAD
Al fooles a comedy, presented at the Black Fryers, and lately before his Maiestie. Written by George Chapman. Chapman, George, 1559?-1634.
[76] p.
Printed [by George Eld] for Thomas Thorpe, At London : 1605.
In verse. The first of two words of the title are xylographic, with the "S" reversed. Printer's name from STC. Signatures: A-I⁴ K² . The first leaf is blank except for signature-mark "A"; the last leaf is blank. Running title reads: All fooles. Variant: title page has "comody". Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======

[76] p.
Printed [by George Eld] for Thomas Thorpe, At London : 1605.
In verse. The first of two words of the title are xylographic, with the "S" reversed. Printer's name from STC. Signatures: A-I⁴ K² . The first leaf is blank except for signature-mark "A"; the last leaf is blank. Running title reads: All fooles. Variant: title page has "comody". Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
Thomas Thorpe
George Eld]
